author: Anonymous Comp
title: I get an error when using the @htdf tag
question:
Hello,
I started reworking the problems from the HTDF lecture today, and when I type “@htdf topple” before starting the design steps, I get an error saying “topple: this function is not defined.”
I do have (require 2htdp/image) and (require spd/tags) typed into the racket file I’m working in as well.
Apologies if this has been covered, but I couldn’t find a solution to this problem on Piazza or on the edx tabs. Thank you for any help!
edit: Sorry about that. Here is the file
(require 2htdp/image)
(require spd/tags)

;; Design a function, called topple, that takes an image and rotates it 
;; by 90 degrees.


(@htdf topple)  
(@signature Image -> Image)          ;signature
;; rotate given image by 90 degrees  ;purpose
instructor_answer: For questions like this it helps to edit your original question, use the {;} button in the Piazza editor, and paste in the exact contents of your file.  Don't retype it, copy and paste it.
